intro: Hieracium taurinense subsp. elocatum, commonly known as the Taurine Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It features basal leaves that are often hairy and yellowish-green, with flowering stems that bear yellow ray florets. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its harsh, high-altitude environment.
